question: What is meant by the term "integration course" in Germany?
context:
Protection in the EU
The European Union, and therefore also Germany, is helping refugees from Ukraine quickly and unbureaucratically.
What does that mean in concrete terms?
Immediate protection in the EU for one to three years
Reception without asylum procedure
Health insurance and medical care
Accommodation
Social benefits
Access to the labor market
Right to education and school attendance
Protection for unaccompanied children and young people
Who can receive this protection?
displaced Ukrainian nationals and their families
Non-Ukrainian nationals and stateless persons who have protection status in Ukraine (and their families)
Non-Ukrainian nationals and stateless persons who have a permanent right of residence in Ukraine and cannot return to their home country

question: How can I apply for a visa for family reunification?
context:
Spousal residence - independent right of residence
Foreign spouses or partners can move to Germany.
Different regulations apply.
After entering the country
New residents must register at the residents' registration office in the town hall within 14 days.
The town hall will issue a registration certificate.
You will receive a national visa (category D) to enter Germany or other Schengen states.
For your future stay in Germany, you must apply for a residence permit at the Foreigners' Registration Office.
You can find more information here.
Integration course
The Federal Office for Migration and Refugees (BAMF) offers integration courses for people with a valid residence permit and little knowledge of German.
In many cases, language skills are a prerequisite for a settlement permit.
Are you applying for a residence permit for the first time?
Then the Office for Immigration and Integration can oblige you to attend an integration course if you do not yet speak German well.
You can find more information here.
Access to the labor market
People who have a residence permit for family reunification are allowed to work.
The residence permit is also linked to the work permit.
They have unrestricted access to the German labor market.
You may work for a company as an employee.
Or become self-employed.
Independent right of residence
Have you been living together for at least 3 years?
Spouses then receive an independent right of residence.
For victims of violence
In certain cases, an independent right of residence can be granted earlier.
For example, if it is no longer reasonable to remain in the marital partnership due to violence.
Then there may be an exception.

question: What health insurance policies are there in Germany?
context:
Visit to the doctor
Free choice of doctor
There are many different doctors in Germany.
You are free to choose your doctor.
General practitioner and pediatrician
Do you feel mentally or physically ill?
Then go to a general practitioner first.
Children must see a pediatrician.
This doctor will provide basic care.
She or he is the first point of contact for all illnesses.
The person carries out an initial examination.
And decides on further treatment.
Sometimes a specialist is necessary.
You will then receive a referral from your general practitioner.
"Referral" means that the general practitioner or general practitioner
The pediatrician will refer you to a specialist.
a medical specialist.
Specialists or
Specialists
Medical specialists specialize in one medical field.
They will take over further treatment after referral.
Opening hours of medical practices
Doctors' surgeries are normally open from Monday to Friday.
The opening hours vary depending on the doctor's practice.
Make an appointment before you go to the doctor!
You need a doctor at night or at the weekend.
a doctor - but it's not an emergency?
Then you can call here and find out which doctor's surgery is currently open:
Medical on-call service
only in the evening and at weekends
116 117
Dental emergency service
only on weekends

question: Where can I get advice on inclusive education?
context:
Education and inclusion
For children from zero to six years
Children with (impending) disabilities can receive early intervention.
You can find more information here: www.landkreis-augsburg.de/fruehfoerderung.
Parents can decide for themselves which facility their child attends.
There are:
Regular daycare centers
All daycare centers in the district are oriented towards the guiding principle of inclusion.
Special facilities for children with disabilities.
Your point of contact for questions:
Child day care center
Petra Hetzner
petra.hetzner@LRA-a.bayern.de
For school-age children
Parents decide for themselves which school their child attends.
There are:
Regular schools
Six general education schools in the district have an inclusion profile.
They teach children with and without disabilities together in regular classes.
Special schools for children with disabilities
There are also three state and two private support centers or
Special schools.
This contact point will help you with questions:
State education authority
Inclusion advice center
beratung-inklusion@LRA-a.bayern.de
Vocational training and studies
In principle, all paths are open in vocational training.
However, there are people who cannot take part in the regular training.
This depends on the individual situation.
There are special offers for these people.
People with disabilities can of course also study.
There is a lot of help available from the university and the Augsburg Student Union.
You can find lots of practical tips and information here: www.studierendenwerke.de/themen/studieren-mit-behinderung/handbuch-studium-und-behinderung.
Facilities and offers can be found in the virtual guide for people with disabilities of the Augsburg District Office: www.landkreis-augsburg.de/wegweiser-fuer-menschen-mit-behinderung.
Outside the classroom or seminar room
The district of Augsburg is very committed to extracurricular education and leisure activities.
Because these offers are important.
People with disabilities can make social contacts here, for example.
To people with and without disabilities.
Extracurricular education and leisure activities include, for example:
cultural attractions
Sports activities
Leisure activities offered by associations or clubs
The Kreisjugendring offers places in its vacation program for children and young people with disabilities.
Your contact person:
Sophie Kraftsik
s.kraftsik@kjr-al.de

context:

Meeting place Café Bellevue di Monaco
Our Infocafé is organized and implemented together with refugees and non-refugees.
Here you can not only eat delicious and inexpensive food (tea and water are free), but also take advantage of counseling services, complete internships, volunteer, attend cultural and political events and come into contact with other people.

question: What are the opening hours of stores in Munich?
context:
Opening hours and public holidays
Opening hours
Most larger grocery stores in Munich are open Monday to Saturday from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm.
Most stores in the city center are open from 10:00 to 20:00.
The times are often shorter for smaller stores.
Sometimes there is also a lunch break.
Almost all stores are closed on Sundays, with only a few stores open at the main station, Ostbahnhof and Munich-Pasing station.
There is no work on a public holiday and all stores are closed (exception: certain professions in shift work).
Many bakeries are open in the mornings on Sundays and public holidays.
Buses and trains run at different times on Sundays and public holidays than on weekdays.
Holidays
There are public holidays for the whole of Germany and public holidays that vary from state to state.
Bavaria has13 public holidays.
Most of them are church-related.
